conclusion: Analyze current positions of shadows and predict new positions based on light source direction.
Shadow A is cast to the right of the white cloth.
Shadow B is cast to the right of the black stool.
Shadow C is cast to the right of the ring.
Shadow D is cast to the right of the avocado.
Light source casts shadows to the right of objects, coming from front-left side.
Light source moves to the back-left above the objects.
Shadows will be cast towards the front-right of the objects when light source moves to back-left.
Shadow A will move to the front-right of the white cloth.
Shadow B will move to the front-right of the black stool.
Shadow C will move to the front-right of the ring.
Shadow D will move to the front-right of the avocado.
Movement of light source changes angle of incidence of light on objects.
Light rays hit objects from behind and slightly to the left, causing shadows to extend forward and to the right.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D shift to front-right of respective objects.
